value: The Roman army left Britain to protect other parts of the Empire.

patches.reasoning: Highlighting common misconceptions about the end of Roman Britain to address them in the lesson.

value.misconception: Roman Britain ended because the Romans were defeated by invaders
value.description: While new groups like the Saxons did settle, Roman Britain ended mainly because the Roman army was needed elsewhere.

value.misconception: All Roman buildings were destroyed after the Romans left
value.description: Many Roman structures remained and were used or adapted by new settlers.
